intro: Hypocalymma angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as heaths and woodlands. It is a perennial shrub that is well adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region.
